question: 老人
sourceMnemonic: An <kanji>elderly</kanji> <kanji>person</kanji> is an <vocabulary>old person</vocabulary> (or an <vocabulary>elderly person</vocabulary>). Don't call a person a <ja>古い人</ja>, though. <ja>古い</ja> is used for things, not people. Be nice, they're your elders.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
